page.title: 13Leisure Activities-Children
page.content: Down the Corvedale there are many clubs for children. The {Brownies }are at the Village hall.Mrs Makins takes the Brownies. It costs 20 pence a week and it is held Thursdays.They play games and have challenges. The{Guides }are held at the Village hall on Thursday and they do things like hiking and camping.Miss Dunne and Mrs Dixon take Guides. Mrs Marston takes{cubs}.They always use the Village hall.There are 16 cubs all together.It costs 30 pence to go in.They meet every week on Wednesday.It is 6.30pm until 8pm Some children have hobbies at home like pony riding, collecting things and roller skating. A lot of children go to youth club at Culmington and some children enjoy swimming and working with computers.
